author: sly_gryphon
content:
I can't find it in the spec, but I presume the intention is that clients keep a record of SignedBeaconBlock that they receive, so that they can respond to requests such as BeaconBlocksByRange.

The spec says clients must support the request, and respond if they have the requested signed blocks, but there is nothing in the spec that requires them to keep a record of signed blocks.  (Fork Choice only requires a record of BeaconBlock, not the signed envelope.)

author: ralexstokes
content: clients are generally going to persist any signed beacon blocks they see come off the wire (you could argue for dropping some of them but the naive thing is to just keep it all unless you detect there is an obvious dos or something...); i interpret the `MUST` in the p2p spec as constraining clients to keep the signed block data

author: ralexstokes
content: and for things like state txn or fork choice you can just think about operating over a subset of this data anyway (aka chop off the signatures)
